div.h2: COVID-19 Closure Learning and Resource Page

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-61dfe83 elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

p.strong: The closing of school affects all students differently. Our main priority at HSPS is ensuring that all of our students’ needs are met, such as food, social, emotional, and mental and physical health. The Governor’s Executive Order mandates that schools provide alternative modes of learning for the remainder of the school year during the closure. HSPS has launched its formal Remote Learning Plan that begins April 20, 2020, the same date that the 4th Quarter begins. All teachers in HSPS use Google Classroom as their main platform for posting assignments and instruction.

div.p: HSPS will have a limited number of hotspots to loan to students. Please contact Mr. Behrmann if you are interested in borrowing a hotspot. Truestream is providing free wifi access around the District (see link to right). Free wifi is available at township halls in Friendship, Readmond, and Cross Village.
i-Ready Family Support Video or call i-Ready support: 800-225-0248

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-20729c6 elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

div.span: If you have a technology issue with a school issued MacBook or iPad, please contact the HSPS helpdesk. We will arrange for a time and location for the device to be dropped off so that we may work on it. The best way to contact the helpdesk is via email to help@harborps.on.spiceworks.com
